text: Can... Pours cloudy with golden with orange highlights and a huge, frothy, white head. Whoa! Its a gusher, but seemingly uninfected. Maybe mishandled or over-carbonated. Pineapple and mango are featured in the aroma. Medium-bodied with adequate carbonation. Not overly effervescent. The flavor is well-balanced, juicy and citrusy, accompanied by moderate bitterness. Crisp, thin finish that numbs the tongue.
Hollander Cafe, Wauwatosa, WI, draft, US Open. Smells fruity. Looks light. Is delicious, tangerine. No head or lacing. Session. Very good.

Growler, from Quality Inn Craft Beer Market. Cloudy yellow pour with a decent white head. Aroma is nice citra hops, resin and spruce, some citrus. Taste is light-bodied but flavourful, juicy, a little sweetness and a little bitterness. Balanced and tasty.

Draught at the brewery. Pours cloudy orange with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy citrus and dank hops with cracker and biscuit malt. Flavor is moderate citrus and dank hops and bitterness with cracker and biscuit malt with a dry finish. Medium-light body and moderate carbonation.

Canned 3/22/2017. Foggy golden yellow with a fair amount of carbonation and a frothy head that dissipates quickly. Smell is fresh-mowed grass, pine, citrus pith, some fruit. Taste is hoppy and dry with more citrus tones, a little sweet in the finish. Very fizzy palate. Pretty delightful day-drinker.
From a growler. Golden yellow pour. Really nice citrus aromas. Some herbal notes in the taste along with citrus. A lot of flavour for a low abv beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is citra, some spruce, wood, herbs and mild floral notes. Flavour is floral, herbal, mild grains, grass and spruce to it. Fresh and pleasant and not overly hopped elements.
On draft at Sanctuary in Iowa City it is a clear golden color with a slight head. The aroma is citrus and the taste is strong bitter sweet with a Bitter finish.
On draft at Sanctuary in Iowa City. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Flavors of caramel and citrus. Bitter finish.

I recently tried Furious for the first time in 10 years and was surprised to learn I dont like it much anymore, too big too chewy. Why do I mention that here instead of re-rating? Mainly because I dont feel like but also to emphasize how much more I liked this one. (side note, what ridiculous nonsense is it to call this an English Pale Ale or Bitter, it has nothing at all to do with that style, not even the slightest little bit). Well this is a great hoppy pale, big citrus nose and flavors, nice balanced palate with dry clean malts, lightly bready, medium bitter finish. Plenty of good citrus and floral notes. Nice cloudy golden color. New England IPA-ish in a sense.

Good floral aroma. Light/medium coloring. Good mouthfeel. Taste is clean and crisp, not too syrupy. Great session beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flight at New Bohemia. Scent is dominated by citrus. Taste starts fruity, is sweet in the middle and finishes hoppy. More sweet bready taste in the middle than most citrus IPAs.
Pours clear straw gold with a small white head. Aroma is tropics. Flavour is mildly bitter with a citrus bend. Finish is bitter with lasting tropics in my mouth location.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrus, pine, semi sweet. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, a pint ...pours a dark golden rusty pour with a nice beige head. Nose is straight up full citrus with softer pine and resin. Taste is pleasant citrus leaning toward passion fruit with a nice confluence of bittersweet hops. Finishes on the  juicy  citrus notes , with mild bitterness, sweetness....excellent ! Quaff Score 8 / 10

16oz can from Discount in Waukesha with a 3/12/17 can date. Pours the color of old gold with little head. Aroma has lemon, tangerine and pale malts. Taste is of sweet fruits, pale malts, lemon, with some straw. Lighter than medium bodied, the blend is decent and the carbonation is solid. Finishes sweetly tangy. Nothing bad, nothing to recommend. 13.4
Pours cloudy gold with white head. Big citrus and grass on the nose. Flavor is citrus and sweet malt with a very clean finish.
B. Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Massive hop aroma, light body, but let it warm up a little and its not too bad, some of the bitterness goes away.
Lots of orange and a good malt backbone. Pours golden with decent head. Bitter finish. Nice balance. Not quite English like the Transatlantic accent. Tap at Meridian Pint.
on tap pours golden with white head citrus and grass aroma taste is citrus and sweet malt

Shared 16 oz. can poured to snifters showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a modest layer of soft white foam, and spots of lacing. The nose was dank, grass & jungle greenery, with light citrus, and subtle malt. Light to medium bodied, with low carbonation, and low texture, the taste was somewhat similar notes, with moderate citrus & rind bitterness, and a dry finish. Tasty and sessionable enough, but devoid of any wow factor.

16oz can. Really not an English Pale Ale, as that might utilize English malts, English hops. I guess Im glad it didnt get categorized as a Session IPA. Its a friggin Pale Ale, and an excellent one at that. Juicy fresh citra aroma, booming tropical and bright. Crackery thin golden malts. Hyper sessionable, with lots of awesome Citra character. No deep green onion or garlic, all light tropical awesomeness. Word Class.

Pours a clear golden with a thin white head. The aroma is heavy and enticing, with lots of grapefruit and mango, some pine, grassy hops, resin, and hints of caramel. The taste is dry with a good degree of bitterness. Tropical, its big on grapefruit, pineapple, orange, and mango. A light caramel backbone, pine, and floral hops are found underneath. A very short grapefruit makes up the aftertaste. This one is light in body, with a sticky texture, and has average carbonation. This is refreshing and rather tasty.

Slightly hazy gold pour with a smallish white head. Aroma is loaded with tropical and citrus hops, with a little melon thrown in, some breadiness, mineral notes and a little tree fruit and lightly earthy spice esters. Flavor is somewhat mineral forward at first, with some stone fruit and pear, then a little breadiness and a pretty good punch of melon, mango, guava and slightly bitter citrus. Light body, crisp feel, moderate hop acid bite, even a bit of the acidic feel on the teeth, medium, sharp carbonation. Fantastic, flavorful, refreshing and surprisingly complex, especially great hot weather beer.

Can. Pours a hazy golden color with small white head. Heavy hop aroma of citrus and grapefruit. Bitter hoppy flavor with citrus notes and a bit of pine. Medium bodied with lingering bitter finish. Big Citra presence in this, great for hopheads.

from a 16 oz can. --
Aroma: hop derived aromas (tropical fruit i.e papaya, mango and citrusy grapefruit) and spices overpower malt derived aromas which are just very subtle.
Appearance: poured into an IPA glass, this pale golden ale displays a lovely one inch thick head with just moderate retention. starts with slight hazyness but clears completely as it warms. decent lacing is observed.
Taste: incredibly smooth balance of tropical flavors, malt sweetness and just the right amount of hop bitterness.
Palate: medium/light bodied with a thin-ish (in a good way) but oily texture. moderate carbonation and significant astringency touching the palate.
The finish is dry with a slow fading astringency.
Overall: this is a very fine session IPA really. the Citra hops shine here on the nose and tongue. Incredibly balanced, drinkable and thirst quenching. I want more...

Pours a very cloudy bright yellow golden color with fizzy white head. Citrus, tons of light fruits and citrus fruits on the nose with just a hint of pine; follows onto the palate. Light bodied and crisp. Finishes with more fruity goodness. Very well done session style beer, flavorful and light.

16oz can. 2/17/17 can date. Appearance: Light golden, hazy, with moderate white foam head. 
Aroma: Smells like a fresh cut grapefruit. Very strong and pleasant, with a light touch of grass. 
Taste: Light crackery malt, quickly turning over to strong hop flavors of piney resin and grapefruit. Bitterness is fairly strong against the low malt base. 
Mouthfeel: Light bodied and a moderate bitterness. 
Finish: Strong lingering bitterness, grapefruit and resin. Little evidence of maltiness. 
Overall: Probably the strongest, freshest hop aroma Ive come across, with wonderful resinous and citrus flavors. Low malt character really makes this feel like a true session pale ale

16 oz. can. Orange/amber body with a small white head. Smells of citrus hops and bready malts. A little bit fruity and sweet smelling, too. Tastes of citrus up front, but its not strong hop flavor. Balanced by a bready and lightly sweet malt flavor. Piney bitterness in the finish. Light bodied. Well carbonated. Well-made, easy drinking, and flavorful. Good stuff.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Cloudy yellow body with a small white head. Light hoppy, pine needles, citrus, fruity.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Surly Xtra-Citra Pale Ale ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light light heavy malty, pale malt, moderate to light heavy hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus, tropical fruit - grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, citrus, pale malt, fruity malt - hops, crispy hops, grass notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160514]
 7-3-7-3-16

Tall boy canned 07/07/16. hazy gold, 1 finger head with some lacing left behind that fades fast. smells good but certainly not the brightness I had hoped. a little cheesy, hay, grass, wheat. Light with oatmeal flavor and a table sugar-esque finish. very drinkable but the english maltiness really wears on me . just not my kind of style.
Tap; pours hazy gold with a white head; citrus fruit aroma with some malt and floral hints; taste is citrus fruits with some hints of malt and pine; finish is dry and bitter; nice beer

Can.

A- Tropical fruit, pineapple, guava, mango, papaya, passion fruit, juicy, citrus.

A- Yellow color, slightly hazy liquid, white head.

T- Subtle bitterness, tropical fruits, slightly dank grass.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- My dumb ass decided to buy this beer quite fresh with only a month of age and for some reason forget about it until four months later. While it wasnt as fresh as I wouldve liked it was still downright delicious. Bursting with tropical fruits on the nose and palate, a perfect balance showcasing Citra. Now I need another to enjoy properly, fresh. Very good.

Can thanks to trade with HuskerTan! Pours a slightly hazy gold with fluffy white head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of big citra hop notes and light grain. Taste is even more of the hops and less of the grain, light and crisp. Very nice hoppy pale.
Pours a bright yellow with short lasting head. Aromas are big citrus. Rind and pith. Definitely some dank aromas and flavours. Pretty tasty brew.

Yellow clear body, off white head, some soapy lacing. Looks nice enough. Pleasant aroma of resin, hops, melon, citrus, lemons. Taste is not as prominent and is a bit too far on the dry side for my preference. Still, not bad.
16 ounce shared can. Pours a hazy pale gold with an average white head. Aroma of citrus, floral, and pine. Taste is grapefruit, lemon, orange, floral, and some pine. Very good.

16 oz can. Canned on 07/07/16. (Happy Harrys) Fargo, ND.br>
Cloudy yellow color with a tiny white head. 
Citrusy and candy hops, mild bitterness, sweetness, bubblegum and malt in the aroma. Theres nothing English in the aroma. Thanks for that! 
The flavor is dry citrusy hops, mild bitterness, candies, malt and some bubblegum. So not English.
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and pine. Malty backbone. Light and watery

Minnesota Trip Beer #1. Tallboy can shared by jackl, 5/7/16.Aroma of pine, citrus, tropical fruit, pale malt. The taste is citrus, tropical fruit, pine, pale malt. Medium bodied, well balanced, lingering bitterness, refreshing. Good start to the trip!

16oz can to tulip. Pours clouded dark gold, white sticky head. Aroma of pine needles, sap, fig, biscuit, orange and grapefruit juice. Taste of same with some caramel, trop fruit and earth in finish. Oh and lots of English breakfast tea.

16 oz can, served in q pint glass. Pours lightly hazy bright orange with medium white head. Aroma is bright juicy citrus notes, lightly floral with no real malt discernable. Taste is likewise, juicy Citra malt dominates without being cloying. At 4.5% you dont expect much malt body, though this is perhaps the most flavorful beer Ive ever had at such a low abv. Impressive, and much more drinkable than their better known IPA selection.
Can. Great Nebraska Beer Fest. Pours clear golden, white head. Aroma was citrus, grass, pineapple, pine. Taste was mild sweet, citrus, pineapple.

Can @ Brads hotel room, Denison. Hazy gold appearance with a cream colored head. Dank aroma with onion, lemon, and grapefruit. Medium light body. Dry with low bitterness. Tons of herbal hop flavor. Mild melon, onion, and a little cracker. Really solid, easy drinker. Great.

This is a pale ale not an IPA and it shows. It tastes like banana boat sunscreen more than citra hops. Not a fan. On tap at Trixies in Madison, WI.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pounder->SA, provided by GenDV110+OT, thanks Donnie! Slightly cloudy lite gold with small frothy white head. A: tropical fruit, citrus hops, very lite malt. T: bittersweet citrus and floral hops, fruit, strong caramel malt. Decent.

Golden, hazy with a fine white head. Aromas of tropical fruits dominate but after a while leaves room for cereal/bready hay notes and more subtle floral impressions too. Fine carbonation, bit slick and medium bodied. Offers a nice juicy malt bed with its sweetness offering a counterpart to a lovely fruity hop bitterness. Well balanced and harmonic offering a medium lasting finish. Quaffer.

Xtra-Citra has a can which bears a striking resemblance to a certain citrusy soft drink thats well-known to folks who were around in the late 90s. Xtra-Citra has tasty enough citrusy flavors that it could develop its own kind of cult following. Golden pour with rocky foam. Bright, tropical citrus aromas. Flavors are balanced beautifully between fruit and aggression. Spiky pine, zesty orange, and grapefruit. Yet, theres also tangerine, mango, guava, and nectar. Definitely a summery beer flavor, but do yourself a solid and let this warm a bit to get the full effect.
Can, shared at RBAG by me. Hazy medium gold. Gooseberries, a little cat pee, white grapefruit, lightly sweet malts, solid bitter finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pint draft at Surly Brewing Company in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The pour is mostly clear golden with a one inch well formed off white head. The aroma is floral, citrus hops with a nice backbone of cracker malt. The taste is mostly about the Citra hops - big bright lemon citrus fruit and peel, along with floral, bit of grass and the clean cracker malt holding up the bottom. The palate is light bodied with active carbonation and a bitter mineral finish. Tasty, easy drinking Pale Ale.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 16 oz can poured into a tulip. Canned on 7/14/2016. Mostly clear golden yellow with a finger of head. Aromas of citrus, light floral, biscuit, malt. Tastes of bitter floral notes, some biscuit, light citrus fruit and peel, a little malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Solid session pale.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: wheat and pepper
Adjunct: Lemon, wheat and shit; boop
Can - Skunk, grassy and some minty notes. Clear gold wit almost no head. Light grass and skunk with some bitter dryness. Solid.

Yummy little critter, sets my heart a twitter, English Bitter? not that style hitter. Malts are dry, hops are fly. Body is light, no reason to fight. Lemony, biscuity, crisp electricity. Cruises along, slight hit from yer bong. Finish is dry, makes me wanna cry, my last one. Props to cheeze puff, though he didnt send quite enough. HaHaaaaa!! Love you bro! Could drink this shit all day long.
CBC 2016 Red session. Clear amber body, arma is hoppy of grass, tropical hps, taste of grains, toast, flowery hops and citrus, dry and crisp, robust bitterness, hoppy citric finish.

Can from the local Hy-Vee. $6.99 / 4-pack? Dont mind if I do. Gold pour with creamy white head. Bready citrus nose. Light bitterness, minimal sweetness. Light body, average carbonation. Crushable and affordable, this would make a great shower beer. Not sure I buy the "English Pale Ale" categorization on here -- you could just as easily call it an APA or session IPA. Not that it matters.

Can shared by Paul, with Vinny and Max. Pours a clear golden body with thin bubbled lacing. Nose is muted overall - essentially nothing. Mouthfeel is thin and crisp with notes of ashy malt and soft muted citrus hop. Pretty plain overall.

Can shared by Paul, pours clearish gold with small white head. Notes are bland grain, ash, and bitterness. Shes a little too English for my dank American blood. No smell and not much flavor to pick out.

Slightly cloudy pale golden pour with a single finger head. Lace present. Aroma is full of a strong floral quality with some citrus notes. Dank grassiness as well, which is classic Citra hop. Light bodied and surprisingly malty which is really nice. Dry finish. Huge amount of hops. Grassy and dank. Not as hoppy as anticipated, which I was quite happy with.
Can. Pours a hazy gold color. Aroma and taste are citrus, wheat, and nice finish.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Aroma: Mildly Malty, Mild Citrus, Mild Resin...Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, Thin White Head Ring, Some Lacing...Taste: Mild Citrus, Mild Malty...Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, fruit, bitter citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is rather bitter, malt, grassy hops, fruit, bitter citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 140516

Tap - big foamy head, light gold color, big citrus hop aroma and flavor, mild malt backbone, dry finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16oz can with commonmac and Qponnagy. Gold with medium white head. Bright citrus hop nose. Cloying citrus hop taste, slightly bitter. Pretty tasty.

16 ounce can into pint glass, canned on 3/23/2016. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, lemon/orange peel, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, lemon/orange peel, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus rind/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, lemon/orange rind, pine, cracker, biscuit, and herbal.floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and no astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness; that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/sticky, and lightly grainy/creamy balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a very nice session pale ale. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
CBC. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, medeium sweet and a little bitter.

Pint can courtesy of Todd. Pours a hazy gold color with a medium off white head. Aroma of Citra hops, orange, grapefruit and light malt. Taste of Citra hops, light grapefruit and orange and notes of light malt. Mild and refreshing.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Red session, København
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, orange, grapefruit and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grapefruity and caramel finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Pours a hazed yellow with a white head. Wheat and pale malt aroma with a touch of sweet tropical fruit. Strong bitterness with tropical fruit and pine. Finishes a bit grassy with grainy malts. This goes down easy.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Red session. Hazy golden color with white to off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, citrusy fruity, orange and mandarin, grassy, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Lightly cloudy yellow, white head. Incredibly bright sharp citrus, mango,
. Fairly resinous, some floral notes. Quite bitter, fairly intensely sweet. Lighter body, very clean. Short finish. Good bit of carbonation. Great.
CBC. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 140516

Can. Pours a deep gold with a shallow, fine-grained, white head. Nose is honey, lemon, lime, toasted grain, and earth. Sweet and citrus up front, with an almost smoky note on the mid palate; finishes bitter and dry. Finishes butterscotch and elegant. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2017 Pours golden minimal head. Deep pine dank aroma heavy citrus grapefriut and lemon. Clean light taste minimal bitterness. Very easy deinkimg but only 4.5% makes it a great tailgating brew!
Tap at Surly. Pale yellow pour. Pungent citrus and peach aroma. Clean light malt, light citrus hop taste. Just tasty.
Poured a hazy gden cor with a wjite jead. Aroma was citra and biscuty malt. Flavor similar, not a big juice bomb but tasty.
CBC16, red sessio, tap. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma medium+ hoppy (grassy, citrusy), light malty. Flavor light sweet, medium bitter, light spicy. Medium body.

Canned 3/23/16, drunk 5/11/16.Clear, apricot-peach colored golden body has large bubbles in solution and a small, off-white head that immediatley fizzles to nothing. Reminds me of Headroom from Trillium. Is this a citra thing?? I really have no idea, but its bizarre to see a head audibly fizzling to literally nothing very quickly in a pale ale.Anyways, the nose is an ultra clean, woody, citric, brightly hopped aroma with light cracker and such backing it lightly. No alcohol, absolutely no flaw. Obviously this can is way past when it should be rated, so I was going to open it and drink it more as a test of the brewing quality. After the hops fade, its decidedly easy to pick up on any brewing flaws. But here, nothing. No wax, cat, garlic, scallion; none of that. Just beautiful cracker and biscuit-like malts with clean minerality, and soft, dusty, dry, leathery citrus that citra is known for. Seems every bit as good as the best and Im happy to rate it based on how even more delightful a fresh sample must have been.
Thanks to Eric Teusink for sharing this on the canoe trip. Solid aroma. Tropical fruit. A little bitter on the palate and finish. Would date again.

Can, much thanks to Chris. Pours out a somewhat cloudy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of some nice sweet, fruity citrus, light cereal, some pine, tropical fruit. Taste is solid, easy drinking with a decent amount of fruity citrus hops, sweet malt, some melon. Really smooth with a nice hop profile.

Clear yellow beer out of the can with a thin, fizzy white head. Big pinching citra hop aroma. This is a bit thin, as the ABV would suggest. Some caramel sweetness with lots of tropical fruit and earthy dank hop flavors. There is an odd herbal note in the finish. Okay citra tea beer.

Sample at CBC 2016.

Clear golden with a white head. Fresh with hops, grass, citrus and some light malt. Medium body and bitterness. Refreshing.

16oz can thanks to Hoff! Pours a chill hazed golden orange with a finger of foamy white head. Aroma of dank citrus hops, cat piss, pineapple, light pine, and bready malts. Taste of citrus hops, light cat piss, hints of pine, bready malts, grass, corn, and yeast.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 16 oz can shared by Claudio. Pours hazy light golden color with white head. Aromas of grass and citrus. Light citrus and grass flavors with a hint of malt. Medium body with average carbonation.
CBC2016. Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, Citrusfrüchte. Geschmack sehr hopfig, grasig bitter, Citrusfrüchte.
16 oz can. Mostly clear light gold pour with a small white head. Nice citrus aroma. Taste is citrus and slight bitterness. Crisp, easy drinker.

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is fresh grassy, leafs, pine needles, moss, hops, citrus peel, lawn, light malts, hints of dried tropical fruits. Taste is slightly dry and fresh grassy, leafs, citrus peel, moss, hops, lawn, hay, pine needles, light malts, bark. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Tap @ CBC -16. clear pale golden with a medium white top. nice citrus atoma with notes of grass, resin and pale malts. light bitter taste with citrus. highly drinkable this. semi dry light bitter finish. light body avg co2
Keg at cbc16.. Golden amber.. Thin white lacing soft passion fruit nose.. Long soft passion fruit nose
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head. The aroma is spicy hoppy with gooseberry and passion fruit. Bit watery mouthfeel. Passion fruit and peach in the flavor.
Tap cbc. Pours light amber with a white head. Aroma of malts, grass, caramel, spicey, herbal, light, tropical, tea like notes. Taste is rather sweet, caramel and gras. Bitter finish.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour us clear light orange with small white head. Fruits, caramel, some hops and malts.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy citrus, biscuity malts and caramel. Taste is crisp, citrusy and fresh hoppy with some biscuity maltiness. Finish is crisp and citrusy with some biscuity notes. Quaffable.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Pours golden color with a thin white head. Nice aggressive hoppyness. Fruit juice, pine. Citrus fruits. Bit thin perhaps. Great nonetheless.

Tap at CBC. Pours hazy golden. Aroma: Lots of citrus. Orange, grapefruit. Light bodied, but good balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 Oz can at World of Beer (Naperville, IL). Excited to finally try this. Pours a decent hazed and dulled golden hue, a harvest color with frothy whitish head atop that stays as a filmy layer, thicker ringer and OK lacing. Aromas are dry, bitter, citric and floral. Firmer grapefruit, soap, earth and cleaner malt bill. Mango and a bit of tropical nectar, pollen, florals, earthy bitterness. Initial lighter bodied, a bit more dull on the hop bitterness off the bat than the nose lets on. Mango, bitter rind, florals and a fruity allure. More floral, green bitterness as we press on. A more flabby carbonation, dulled bitterness. A bit of spiciness, lingering Citra fruity appeal is sufficient. Some pineapple, tangerine, grapefruit pithy appeal as we round the corner. A bit grassy, bitter, soapy and fruity as we finish up. A more dulled pour, appealing potent nose. The beer itself is light but perhaps a touch under bittered and carbed. Still, the flavors flow, offer enough to make this one still pretty enjoyable.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home after a nice run on a nice mid-May weeknight. This is fantastic for the style, probably the best Ive had. Appearance is a pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is a unique blend of orange citrus and lime zest, smells like a fantastic summer beer. Taste is just great, really fantastic bitterness with a great crisp finish, notes of citrus and lime. Will probably pick up a 4 pack of this one.
Pour at DLD2016. Pours a slightly cloudy pale orange yellow with a white head. Aromas of light tangerine. Pretty subdued in general but a clean hoppy beer.

16 oz can poured a clear gold with a lingering ring of ivory foam. Aromas of straw, dank bud, pine and light citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of straw, lemon zest, dankness and grapefruit zest with a smooth dry bitter lingering grapefruit zest finish.
Lacks some depth but it is a citruscy pale. Very similar as zombie dust but better. Crisp light Abv makes it really crushable. Pours light copper with a white head. Had at home
Spectacular nose...just so fresh and bountiful, a little grapefruit but more tangerine. The flavor isnt as good and some bitterness sets in. But it is still juicy and tasty. Bottle.

Thanks to terminus for sharing this with me. The beer pours golden yellow with an off-white head. The aroma has tangerine, orange, grape fruit comma dry malt and in the English yeast. It has a slightly rough medium light body with a pretty good amount of carbonation. The Taste is not nearly as citrusy as the aroma, it has more of a dry bready malt, earthy/fruity yeast and some woodiness. The finish is dry and clean. Really nice, especially for the alcohol content.

16oz can poured at home.

The aroma is very good for a 4.5% beer.

It is very easy to drink, and goes very well on the lawn mower.

Can, pours a hazy yellow body with a white head. Nice citrus aroma including grapefruit, lemon, and orange. Theres not much of a taste to this one; some light bread and malts with a light bitter grapefruit finish. Rather watery, but seems sessionable.

16 oz. can pours a hazy golden orange with small fizzy white head. Aroma is full of citrus. Taste is bitter and hoppy with some bready malts in the middle. Finish is short. Body is medium with average carbonation. This is one of the more surprising pale ales Ive tried lately. A true citrus bomb that is refreshing and doesnt knock you out.
From a 1 pint can. Poured a hazy golden yellow color with a quickly fizzling white head. Aroma was light citus, juicy notes. A little light, malt heavy. Tasty, but not mind blowing.

Tasted from a pint can. It poured a hazy golden hue with a thin white head. Lemony nose and a bitter hopped taste with a kinda watered down finish. I expected so much more from a Surly brew made with Citra hops. Quite a disappointment.

Tap at the source. Pours fairly clear orange. White head. Aroma is tangerine, citrus, mango, lemon. Phenomenal citrus bomb. Flavor is tangerine, lemon, citrus, grass, pretty bready. Not overly bitter at all. Definitely stays in that pale ale category. Really nice.

16oz can 4/28/16 (Binnys Naperville Singles Rack)-42° in English Pint-Pours hazy golden with a loose off white head. Aroma of citrus. Taste of citrus and more citrus. This light bodied brew is hoppy and more hoppy. Great session brew.
16 oz can. Clear amber pour with an off-white head. About as well-balanced as a pale gets. Citrus, cereal, clean finish. This is easy drinkin at its best.

16 ounce can from Costco. Very hoppy aroma and great hoppy taste. Not a lot of body to it, which is why it is a session IPA. Great hoppy beer you could drink all day. I think it will be a great lawnmower beer, if it ever quits raining.

Can-Pours slightly hazy orange hue with a small fizzy white head. Not much really to look at. Huge nose of all Citra hop goodness. Big flowery c hops, big bright yeast and lightly toasted grains (crackers). Very well balanced brew. My only gripe with the beer is the flavor. It seems a bit metallic long into the finish and this was a pretty fresh can. Body is a bit flat as well. With all that, i could crush a ton of these in a sitting. Very solid session IPA if you ask me. It is NOT an English pale.

Can. Cloudy apricot hue with a wispy white cap. Juicy Fruit gum with splashes of peach and grass in the nose; orange blossom honey acts as a sugary base. The flavor isnt nearly as exciting, kicking off with a similar fruity, gummy blend but finishing with a fizzle. Bitterness rises long after the swallow, but this could use more oomph at its conclusion.

16 oz can poured. Pours a clear and shiny golden color with a lasting foam head. Lemon citrus, and grassy hop aroma. Flavor is very nice citrus fruit, with a near perfect level of sweetness. Hop flavor, but no bitterness. So refreshing and tasty. I could crush a ton of these.

Hazy straw yellow with an average white head that quickly disappears and leaves ok lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit, dank bud, and bready malts. Taste is dank pine, grapefruit, tangerine, and more bready malts in the back. Very juicy and light bodied with a dryer finish. Nice session beer.

Draft. Pours gold with a slight orange hue; off-white head and lacing. Earthy and resiny pine aroma with some grapefruit notes. Grapefruit and citrus flavor upfront. Caramel malt and earthy pine hops in the clean, crisp finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of big citrus and grain. Taste is a citrusy bomb. Nice bitterness

Can thanks to footbalm. Nose is huge in orange marmalade and smells like fresh zest. light lime as it warms with some tropical notes. lightly hazy, pale golden with small white head. Taste is light biscuits with a buttery marmalade. Freaking crushable. A tad thin in malt compared to bitter brewer from what I recall but damn this is crushable. overall a grate beer for drinking

Draft. Gold in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of mango and citrus, mowed weeds, and a bit of pale malt. Light bodied on the palate with flavors of new American hops and crispy pale malts. Quite refreshing with a snappy bitterness. I should have bought cans of this in retrospect, as they would go down quite nicely on a hot day.
On tap, cloudy 14k gold hue with minimal white creamy head, not much lacing, smells faint citrus, light medium texture, some citrus flavor, aight

16 oz can from De Bierkoning @ home (canned 03/22/2016, so 4 weeks ago). Golden color, a bit hazy. White head, not much. Upon opening strong resinous aromas, after pouring in the glass the citrus comes out, but still some resin. Retronasal theres also some malt. Flavor is light grainy sweet, light bitter, with some fruity sourness. Light bodied, not too thin. A bit earth butter finish. Pleasant and sessionable.

16 oz. can, in a free box from jackl. Pours pale yellow, with a medium, off-white, bubbly head. The nose is orange peel, heavy cloves, butter toffee, light cinnamon, and oregano. Sweet and herbal, with a sharp, pleasant bitterness. Long, sticky, bitter aftertaste. Medium body, acidic, lightly carbonated, and crisp. This is a surprisingly delicious beer, with great aroma and nicely balanced flavor.

Hazy golden color; Light to medium body; Aroma of malt, nice citrus hops, & hay/floral; Flavor of slight sweet malt/biscuit, citrus hops, light pine, and some fruit; Finish is dry & slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good session ale.
Sampled at winterfest and later a full pour from a can. Big citrus aroma and lots of citrus hops. Smooth, light palat, balanced with some dry, doughy malt and biscuit. Good, clean pale ale.

On tap in a pint glass before Father John Misty at Stub & Herbs on U of M campus. Very light straw golden with little white head probably due to the effort of the individual pouring the suds. Aroma is grassy and grainy with citrus incorporating itself into the equating eventually. Taste is mild but citrus forward with a definite ease of drinkability. It definitely has bitterness but its not to the beers detriment. One of those options you could have a few of and not blow up youre whole night. Hoppy finish that doesnt linger. First sessionable offering from the brewery and its decent.

Im a huge Surly fan, but this just didnt do it for me. Certainly lots of citra flavor but generally unbalanced and harsh. Ill try it again, cold on a hot afternoon, as I think thats how it will work best.

16 oz. can, consumed on 4-10-16. Fresh, mineral smell. Subtle version of Citra in the aroma. Armpit scent; no citrus. Pours a clear, light brass to gold. Moderate effervescence. Large amount of uneven, off-white head. Looks good mainly because of the head. Simple but pleasant, dry taste. Flavors of cracker and rocks. Dry finish and aftertaste. Light body. Refreshing. Smooth and frothy in the palate. Palate effects are what the imbiber desires in this sort of beer, but they are nothing outstanding. Overall, a decent spring refresher. Nothing special. One of the lesser beers in Surlys oeuvre. Well-made beer, as is standard for Surly, but boring, which is not standard for Surly.
Can from brad...nice golden pour with light carbonation...minimal head and no lacing....nose is citrus hops and pine...fairly nice citrus flavors...smooth...dries quickly...ok i guess...(#814)
Aroma is Citra hops, malts and an earthy undercurrent. The flavor is Citra hops, biscuit malts, fruit/very light citrus and a mix of mild/medium bitterness and earthy in the finish.

16 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Slightly hazy, golden, nice white head but no real lacing. Aroma of hops, certainly citra; some tropical fruit and hay. Taste follows, bitter, citrusy, some sweetness from malts and some grain/hay notes. Easy to drink and very enjoyable.

This is a solid session IPA but Im not 100% in love w/ the hop character; its very herbal and piny. This is a moderatly hazed pale beer w/ a foamy white head. It is light bodied and moderately carbed and would probably come off as watery were it not for a hefty does of bitterness in the finish. There is a hint of malt sweetness that seems to highlight some fruity peach notes from the hops. This is a real nice and drinkable beer over all w/ loads of hops so if you are a fan of more savory hop varieties, give this one a go.

Pale amber color with a thin head. Moderate dank and light lemon aroma. Bracing bitterness. Very grainy flavor. Quite dry. This seems like a bad mashup. The label suggests an American style session IPA, which this is far too grainy and way too low on hop flavor for. In reality, its a English Bitter, but the malt character is just dusty American grain, not the toast/nut/bread of British malts. I definitely would not think of Citra if it wasnt on the label.
473ml can. This is a replacement to bitter brewer i guess. This does not seem as good. Much more watery with some dank funky type hop flavor and aroma. Its boring and weird.

English as is low alc, not hop. Might as well call it an American session pale ale. Pours a gold light gold with peach. Aroma is nice, some lemon and light fruit, light caramel sweetness some graininess. Light malt strong hop lemon a little herbal/grass, kinda dry.Little bit of bubble gum ester ( maybe the English edge?). Pretty good session but would be pricey to session but fair price for Surly considering its low abv.

Can dated 3-23-16. Flat clear yellow. Aroma is citrus zest. Taste is mild orange, hay malt. Very light on the citra hops. Pretty meh, but considering the ABV is light lager territory it works if you need something light.

A bit disappointed in this after discussing it some beer friends. I was hoping for a tropical fruit, citrusy beer, then once we had it in hand, realized its a English ale.. Clear, yellow, golden with a small head that goes away fast. This has citrus - plenty of lemon, but no tropical notes at all. The flavor certainly has the English ale touch to it. Crackery malt. Could use more balance. Nice bitterness, though. Would be better with food, I think. Its not bad, just too lemony for my tastes. No need to have this again.

Can poured hazy straw yellow with a medium white head and dissipating lacing. Aromas of juicy Citra hops, grain, lemongrass, and crackers. Flavor is semi sweet forward with a mild bitterness. The hop nose was great, but it lacked the fruity hop flavor I was hoping for.

Poured from 16oz can at home (thx chad!). Bright yellow with a little later of foamy head. Smells incredible - lemon, bitter and fresh. Taste is a little watery but very good for being 4.5 abv. Spice, citrus and a little malty. I like.

Can - 4.5% alcohol and $7.99 a 4-pack? Shut the front door, Surly! Light golden pour with a foamy off-white head. Nose is basically just Citra, all dank and citrusy with just a bit of toffee malt in the background. Yum. Taste is pretty much the same--just a dry malt base with a ton of pungent Citra hops. Gets a little watery near the finish, but I expect that with 4.5%. One-note, but thats fine--the can tells you exactly what you are getting. Biting carbonation and a thinnish body.

Can pours an ugly clearish pale golden with a small off-white head. Citrus orange and grapefruit aroma, lightly resinous, with honey dew melon. Big bitter citrus hops with dry English toffee and caramel malts. Simple, light, and drinkable. Lacking great flavor, but love the price point, cant wait for a hot day for this one.
Had it out of a can, Poured a clear light Orange hue with a medium head that fizzed loudly when it poured and then disappeared. Watery taste with whispers of city swirling around my head. Funky.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow, with middling head. Aroma is very dank, ctirusy, floral, even a hint of onions there. Flavor is very different from the aroma: kind of muted, theres almost a touch of mint in the mix, along with lots of grassiness, and some malt sweetness. Its a fairly well-balanced beer. Not my favorite Surly IPA.
Light and clean. Citrus hops, nit of grass on the back end. Another solid beer from Surly.

Can. Pale yellow-gold pour, medium white head. Nose is crackery malt, citrus, geraniums, lemongrass, hay, pine. Mouth is light bodied, tropical fruit, toasted bread, dry and mild. Surly hits another homerun Fill a swimming pool with it and find me a diving board.

Pours a clear, dark yellow color with a frothy off-white head. The aroma is full of citrus and a decent presence of hops. The taste is a lot different than expected. Its light easy drinking and has a very thin texture. The after taste lingers nicely with a nice hoppy finish.
Can. Mostly clear light gold pour with a small white head. Nice citrus aroma. Similar taste but not the flavor explosion I was hoping for. Still good. Crisp, easy drinker.

16 oz. can. Pours a hazed golden with a minimal head. Big, Citra aroma with toasty crackery malt. Flavor is hoppy, dry, with bright citra flavors. Some malt sweetness. Lively bodied, sparkling carbonation. Finishes long and hoppy. A stunning crusher.
Gold. Pops with typical Citra. Somewhat grassy pine and mild tropical fruit. Flavor marmalade malt and somewhat generic, mild pine. Light. Like a Bitter Brewer with Citra.

Agressive pour results in only a small, thin, white head that recedes very quickly to a thin rim with no lacing. Very nice citrus aroma, but not much else; simple aroma, no complexity. Clear and golden color. Moderate to light carbonation. Thin mouth feel. Piney bittering on the initial taste, persisting through the middle, but ending in a pleasant aftertaste with the bittering still lingering, but where what malt there is presents itself. The simplicity of the aroma and the dominance of bittering with little flavor contribution from the citra hops is disappointing, even more so given the competitions much more successful use of citra. This is one of those "for a" beers... enjoyable "for a" session ale, so as a summer "boat beer" most will find it more than acceptable. But no complexity at all, little flavor, and the thin body results in a less than desirable pale ale. And, even within the "session ale" (below 5% ABV) category, it is near the bottom of the pack from those that I have tried. There are much better session ales out there, including *most* of the Minnesota-brewed session ales.

Can. Pours clear brass color with very little head. Nose is mild Citra. Mango and maybe a little metallic. Taste is creamy tropical. Flavor won't blow the back of your head off but very pleasant drinking beer.

Can from Johns - into glass. Pour is nearly clear yellow with a quickly dissipating layer of white foam. Unassuming appearance. aroma is light mango, pineapple, and citrus with faint sweetness. Light and clean aroma. Palate is a touch undercarbed for my taste. Flavor is light citrus and mango with a biscuit malt presence. Finish is a little peppery and a little bready. Crushable but not all I had hoped for.

Picked up a four pack from Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, Minnesota. Pours a semi-clear golden straw colored brew with a thin white head that quickly dissipates to a film top and average white ring. Aroma of lots of tropical and grapefruity Citra hops with a hint of golden grain malt. Taste is light bodied and has more toasted golden grain malt flavors than the tropical fruit hop presence compared to the aroma. Finish is light, mildly bitterness that quickly disappears leaving some toasted golden grain aftertaste. A sessional pale ale? You darn tootn it is.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 Pours a clear straw color with minimal head and lacing. This one is better left in the can. Aroma is fresh, dank citrus and some hay. Taste is fruity and dry with crisp carbonation and pale cracker malts. Not quite as good as I remember Citra Sunshine Slacker to be, but to be fair that one is more my style as a straight Session IPA and this one is a bit more ambiguous. No matter what you call it, I love this style of beer, and it seems best suited to be experienced from a cold can on a hot summer day in the middle of a lake. And its cheap.

March 29, 2016 - can from AV3. Clear golden pour into my Surly pint glass with nice amount of head that faded rather quickly. Very nice tropical fruit / citrus aroma. Taste was a bit mild, but nicely balanced. This will be a great summer beer and $6.99 for a 4 pack of 16 ounce cans seems like a steal.

On Draught
Pours lightly hazy & pale as straw... The head is small but well retained. 

The aroma is bright & hoppy with orange, melon, & white grape. Its got a reasonably dank character to it. Very inviting!

The flavor is great, nicely dry with a light toasty malt character. The hoppiness is bright and orange like with a very mild but ever present level of bitterness. 
 Love beers like this

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Can from Vinfera. Gold pour with a modest white head. Aroma is dominated by the citra. Plenty of tropical fruits. Grapefruit and passion fruit. A bit of underarm. A bit musty. Some straw. Flavor is fairly bitter. Extremely dry. Restrained pale malt back bone. Hay. Lightly chalky. Mild citrus and white grape. Light body, strong carb.
Draft at Grumpys. Clear yellow color. Aryof bitter kemon. Taste is similar.

Clean pale gold, negligible head forming. Early signifiers are lime zest and unripe mango, with scallion and burnt corn kernels, gritty earthiness. Almost papery, ashy, like the burnt casing of grilled sweet corn. The flavor is even more forward, and after an initial blast of scorched onion skin, larger gulps reveal some juicier lime and apricot bristling with pine needles. Burnt seeds and dry cracker for malts. Thin palate, streamlined, crisp carb; the aggressive and pungent bitterness is the lasting impression, though a touch of floral honey lingers momentarily at the end.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 On tap at Grumpys NE. Pours a near clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of oniony citrus with a bit of pine with some earthy grain underlying. Flavor has earthy citrus with some earthy pine and some sweet grains supporting.
Tap @ Grumpys. Pours a kinda hazy gold. Tons of citra on the nose, taste is more citra, actually really nice. Surly crushes this.
